Description: Fragment of a pottery hydria or krater; horizontal handle and part of body; reddish/brown painted bands: horizontal band underneath handle,band on top of the handle, start of wavy line in handle zone to right of handle. Reddish brown clay with some dark inclusions; Munsell 2.5YR 5/4 (reddish brown).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 17
Curator's comments: Findspot number '17' scratched by Petrie. Compare with BM GR 2010,5002.30.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 359)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.207)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 2010,0502.46 (incorrect number given on p.207 of Leclère and Spencer 2014)
